required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Impact of COVID-19 by P.1 SARS-CoV-2 Lineage
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Impact of Coronavirus Disease 19 (COVID-19) Caused by P.1 Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) Lineage

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

collaborator.agency: Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado do Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil

clinical_study.source: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

brief_summary.textblock:
Since the first report of the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) variant of concern (VOC) P.1 in Manaus, Brazil, a rapid spread of this lineage across the country has been observed. Recent studies indicate that this variant is associated with higher transmissibility; it is not known whether it is associated with clinical severity and higher mortality rates.
This is a retrospective cohort study carried out at Hospital de Clínicas de Porto Alegre. Adult patients aged 18 years or more and 65 years or less who were admitted to the hospital due to symptomatic COVID-19 from June 2020 to May 2021 and had a reverse transcriptase-polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) cycle threshold value for either SARS-CoV-2 N1 or N2 target ≤ 25 were eligible to the study. Samples from 86 patients (43 from June 2020 to November 2020 and 43 from February 2021 to May 2021) were sequenced for further evaluation. These dates were defined since the emergence of P.1 lineage in late January.
Clinical data regarding ventilatory support, date of onset of symptoms, laboratory findings and mortality were collected from each patient. This retrospective cohort aims to assess whether the number of days needed for supplementary oxygen either by noninvasive ventilation or high-flow nasal cannula from onset of symptoms differs among patients infected with the P.1 SARS-CoV-2 variant and those infected with other variants.

primary_outcome.description: Number of days needed for supplementary oxygen either by noninvasive ventilation or high-flow nasal cannula from onset of symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients in each category in the ordinal scale during hospitalization
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients in each category in the ordinal scale during hospitalization. Ordinal scale levels: 1, patient not hospitalized; 2, hospitalized and not receiving supplemental oxygen; 3, hospitalized and receiving supplemental oxygen; 4, hospitalized and receiving oxygen supplementation administered by a high-flow nasal cannula or noninvasive ventilation; 5, hospitalized and receiving mechanical ventilation or extracorporeal membrane oxygenation; and 6, death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Arterial oxygen partial pressure (PaO2)/ Fractional inspired oxygen (FiO2) evolution during hospitalization
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients in each category according to PaO2/FiO2 value: 400-301, 300-201, 200-101, <=100.
Death for any cause from onset of symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to death from onset of symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days from the onset of symptoms to death
Death for any cause from hospital admission

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to death from hospital admission
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days from the hospital admission to death

secondary_outcome.measure: Days alive and free of supplemental oxygen support.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days alive and free of supplemental oxygen support
Number of days from the onset of symptoms to mechanical ventilation or Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO)
Proportion of patients admitted to Intensive Care Unit
Death for any cause during hospitalization
Number of patients with documented deep venous thrombosis or pulmonary embolism

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients requiring renal replacement therapy (RRT)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients requiring any form of RRT during hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients requiring prone positioning
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients requiring prone positioning during hospitalization

arm_group.description: Patients infected with the P.1 SARS-CoV-2 variant
Patients infected with SARS-CoV-2 variants other than P.1

intervention.description: Collection of clinical and laboratory data

study_pop.textblock: Patients aged 18 to 65 years, seeking medical care in Hospital de Clínicas de Porto Alegre due to symptomatic COVID-19, admitted from June to November 2020 or from February to May 2021.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged 18 to 65 years
- Hospital admission due to symptomatic COVID-19
- RT-PCR was collected from June to November 2020 or from February to May 2021
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients admitted for reasons other than COVID-19
- Asymptomatic patients with positive routine screening with RT-PCR
- Patients transferred from other institutions

facility.name: Hospital de Clínicas de Porto Alegre

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre
